ref.mixed-citation:
Dash PK ,
Kaminski R ,
Bella R ,
Su H ,
Mathews S ,
Ahooyi TM ,
Chen C ,
Mancuso P ,
Sariyer R ,
Ferrante P
: Sequential LASER ART and CRISPR treatments eliminate HIV-1 in a subset of infected humanized mice. Nat Commun 2019, 10: 2753. 31266936

note.p: This report describes that sequential treatment of HIV-infected humanized mice with ‘long-acting slow-effective release’ (LASER) ART and CRISPR–Cas9 reagents caused viral clearance and prevented viral rebound in a subset of the treated animals. Transfer of splenocytes and bone marrow cells from these dual-treated virus-free animals to uninfected humanized mice failed to produce infectious progeny virus, which provided additional support for successful virus elimination.
